alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 17 at 7:00PM EST until December 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level is likely in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline with the Monday afternoon high tide. Locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level is possible. Around 1 ft inundation above ground level is possible with tonight`s high tide. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk, Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM Sunday to 6 PM EST Monday. Minor flooding possible with tonight`s high tide. Widespread moderate flooding is expected with the Monday afternoon high tide, with a low probability for localized major flooding. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread flooding (up to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level) of vulnerable areas is expected near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront. Locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level is possible. Numerous road closures are likely, and vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 ft along the Rockaways and 12 to 16 ft along Long Island ocean beaches will result in widespread beach flooding and dune erosion. Scattered overwashes are likely where dune structures are compromised, causing flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind them. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak surge of 3 1/2 to 5 ft will likely be between high tidal cycles Monday morning. Timing of windshift closer to the early Monday afternoon time of high tide will increase potential for localized major flood thresholds to be reached. This will likely not be evident until the time of high tide is approaching, so residents of vulnerable coastal locales should prepare for the potential of major flooding (3 ft of inundation above ground level) late Monday morning into Monday afternoon. In addition, heavy rainfall and/or runoff coinciding with tonight and Monday afternoon high tides will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along the coast and tidally affected rivers. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. GREAT SOUTH BAY AT LINDENHURST NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.1 FT, MODERATE 3.6 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/01 PM 2.3/ 2.8 0.8/ 1.3 1.0/ 1.5 2 NONE 18/02 AM 3.1/ 3.6 1.5/ 2.0 2.0/ 2.5 2-3 MINOR 18/01 PM 3.5/ 4.0 1.9/ 2.3 2.2/ 2.7 2 MOD-MAJ 19/02 AM 1.5/ 2.0 -0.2/ 0.3 0.4/ 0.9 1 NONE GREAT SOUTH BAY AT WEST SAYVILLE NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
